intro: Gomesa messmeriana, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of bright yellow, star-shaped flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Gomesa messmeriana thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms.
